website_summaries.verdict: Though competent at its one job, the Kidde RemoteLync Monitor is a tough sell. For the same $100 price, you can find smart-home gadgets that do more.
pros: The Kidde RemoteLync Monitor responds quickly to smoke and CO alarms that sound near it
It sends push notifications and works with IFTTT and the Kidde RemoteLync Security Camera for useful interoperability
cons: Unless you have a small house, you'll need more than one Monitor to cover all of your detectors as the range of the Monitor disappoints
It struggled to pick up alarms one floor above or below it

customer_reviews.title: It would be stuck on a screen saying something like "Connected! Attempting to connect
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get through the connection process. I attempted the connection process using my Android phone. The app on my phone would switch to the kidde network, connect it to my home network, switch back to my home network, and attempt to communicate with it there. My router confirmed that the device was connected, but the app could not complete the process. It would be stuck on a screen saying something like "Connected! Attempting to connect..." I tried several times with no success. Their customer support still hasn't returned my email after 2 weeks. I recommend getting a Leeo instead.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: I tested this device the day it arrived, and ...
customer_reviews.text: I tested this device the day it arrived, and it failed. In particular, I added it to my wifi (and could see it listed in the Kidde app in my phone), pressed the test button on the unit, waited for the voice prompt to activate a smoke alarm, then held down the test button on a smoke alarm for 5 cycles. This device failed to hear the alarm, even then the smoke alarm was in the same room. I have already returned the device and gotten a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Joel LIpschultz

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Could not get it to connect to Wi-Fi using the Kidde app so it wouldn't even install. Don't think the individual unit is defective given the large number of other reviews saying the same thing. Returned it to Amazon the same day. Definitely don't buy one from a vendor that isn't Prime if you are considering trying one.
customer_reviews.author: Sparx

customer_reviews.title: I don't understand the bad reviews. I bought this device 6 months ago
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand the bad reviews. I bought this device 6 months ago. Easy to install and it works. I have not had an actual alarm go off, but I have gotten notifications when our internet connection has gone down. Then another notification when it comes back up to let me know the monitor is working again. Also, the app works great.
customer_reviews.author: Scribbles

customer_reviews.title: Terrible app and product support
customer_reviews.text: I am very computer saavy, and when I set this product up It gave me registration errors, there was no intuitive way to start over. The product documentation was terrible. I am returning this device. Not to mention I sent an email to their support. It still has not been answered after a week, I placed a call to product support.. they said they would call back... still no call.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, recognized my smoke and CO alarms
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, surprisingly small, and recognized my smoke and CO alarms on the first try. Withholding the fifth star until it is time-tested for false positives and false negatives. (Occasional false positives would be fine, as my webcams can quickly confirm/deny whether the alarms are going off.)
customer_reviews.author: Brian Holtz

customer_reviews.title: The app does not connect to the device
customer_reviews.text: Per Kidde. Called and talked to them. They don't know when it will be fixed. Look for app dated after today before purchasing to even have a chance of this device working. I tried and returned two - both with manufacture dates in March of 2015....
customer_reviews.author: TAM

customer_reviews.title: Never worked, did not get refund after return it
customer_reviews.text: This one should have a zero star. One star is over-rated. Totally a piece of junk. And I returned it and never get refund.
customer_reviews.author: peony

customer_reviews.title: No connection issues as others had. Thankfully did not ...
customer_reviews.text: No connection issues as others had. Thankfully did not 100% test it (i.e. a fire), but it's own test/program mode verified it does listen to detector I put in basement near furnace.
customer_reviews.author: DorCino

customer_reviews.title: Junk.
customer_reviews.text: Will not connect to app. Have gone through roughly 10 of these, one actually worked. Stay far away.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Fecke

customer_reviews.title: When set up, this product seems to work well ...
customer_reviews.text: When set up, this product seems to work well. The trick is getting it set up. I first tried to set it up using my Android phone running version 7.0 (Nougat). I couldn't get it to connect to my home wifi network. Then I started over again using my iPad. I was able to get it connected but I had a hard time figuring out the learning process. Finally, I did a paper clip reset and went through the setup again using my iPad. Finally I figured out the learning process and everything is working. I would give this five stars if not for the Android failure and the difficult setup procedure.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and effort.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two different units. Tried to install in two different zip codes,two different WiFi systems,two different I-phones....same uninstallable results. Neither would successfully connect and complete the installation process. Tried multiple times at each location. Very disappointing. Amazon returns is a great feature !
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Think it works but have received 3 emails saying it's gone off when it hasn't
customer_reviews.author: rns

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: little problem with setup but tech assist helped and now it works perfectly
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I have owned two of these, and they are ok, discontinued for a reason
customer_reviews.author: TapThatTech Co

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: it detects smoke alarms and emails me. wish it would text
customer_reviews.author: J. Barker

customer_reviews.title: I have a hidden network and it's pretty useless.
customer_reviews.text: PITA to configure. I have a hidden network and it's pretty useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Hair

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous setup
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely impossible to setup, buggy product. After several hours of install appeared to be monitoring but failed to go thru alarm testing. JUNK
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir K.

product_meta.title: Kidde RemoteLync Monitor 120V Plug-in
product_meta.description: Remote Lync Monitor, Simply Plug In A Single Unit, Which Will Listen For Any UL Listed Smoke Or CO Alarm That You Currently Have Installed In Your Home, If It Hears An Alarm, It Will Send You Or Key Contacts That You Define A Message On Your Smart Phone, Tablet Or PC, Using Your Home Wi-Fi Router, Alerting You, User Friendly Way To Support A Connected Home, Ideal For A Primary Residence, Vacation Home Or Rental Property, Uses Patented Technology To Distinguish Smoke & Co Alarm Warnings From Background Noise, Reducing Potential Nuisance Alerts, When Homeowner Receives The Alert, There Is An Option To Call 911 Directly, Temporarily Hush The Warning, Or Call A Contact In Their Network, Does Not Require Additional Products, Hubs Or Monthly Fees To Function.
feature_bullets: This product is easy to use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 1.8 out of 5 stars44 ratings1.8 out of 5 stars
